conclusion: Objects A and B are in the air; Objects C and D are on the table.
Objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C and D.
Objects A and B will come into contact with objects C and D due to gravity.
If objects A and B are placed directly on top of objects C and D, they will stack on them.
If objects A and B are placed in such a way that they push objects C and D, there might be displacement or movement of objects C and D.
If objects A and B are placed with force, they might collide with objects C and D, causing them to move or fall.
Objects A and B will either stack on top of objects C and D or cause them to move slightly due to the impact.
Final answer: Objects A and B will likely stack on top of or slightly displace objects C and D due to gravity.
